definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means

sentences.english: He was a master of administration and diplomacy .
sentences.chinese: 他是行政和外交事務方面的一個傑出人物。

sentences.english: Choi Kang is director of American studies at the Institute for Foreign Affairs and National Security in South Korea.
sentences.chinese: 崔江是韓國外交事務和國家安全研究所美國項目主任。

sentences.english: In foreign affairs, we dealt with a lot of headaches.
sentences.chinese: 在外交事務中，我們處理了很多麻煩事。

sentences.english: The rapprochement with the United States continued to dominate China's foreign affairs.
sentences.chinese: 當年中國外交事務的主調依然是和美國的友好關係。

sentences.english: It is typical for China to act as a bully child in terms of its foreign affairs.
sentences.chinese: 這是中國外交事務中典型的欺負人。

sentences.english: A house representative's foreign affair's committee endorsed the non-binding resolution.
sentences.chinese: 衆議院外交事務委員會贊成該沒有法律約束力的決議。

sentences.english: Clinton's disengagement from foreign affairs was an exercise in self-discipline and realpolitik.
sentences.chinese: 克林頓的脫離外交事務是一次演習在自律和權力。

sentences.english: The press has downplayed the president's role in the foreign affairs.
sentences.chinese: 報界貶低了總統在外交事務中所起的作用。

sentences.english: Biden distinguished himself in the Senate in foreign affairs.
sentences.chinese: 拜登在參議院外交事務上的成就顯赫。

definition: to take turns/to work by roster
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
